details.title: Phase Detector Data Distortion in Phase-Lock Loop Receivers
details.abstract: The nonlinear characteristic of a sinusoidal phase detector can create an additional loop suppression factor and cause distortion of any phase-modulated data that is to be extracted in a phase-lock loop receiver. The distortion caused by the phase detector's sinusoidal characteristic will degrade the phase-lock loop parameters and decrease the amplitude of the phase-modulated data.
details.journal_title: IEEE Transactions on Aerospace and Electronic Systems
